meanings.definition: A person or thing that swarms.
meanings.sent1: The swarmer quickly joined the group of excited fans.
meanings.sent2: The bees swarmer buzzed around the hive.
meanings.sent3: The swarmer of kids running towards the ice cream truck was a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The swarmer of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The swarmer of ants marching in a line was like a moving carpet.

meanings.definition: A member of a swarm, especially of insects.
meanings.sent1: The swarmer bee landed on a flower to collect nectar.
meanings.sent2: The swarmer mosquitoes were out in full force during the summer.
meanings.sent3: The swarmer of bees decided to throw a party in the beehive.
meanings.sent4: The swarmer of butterflies painted the garden in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The swarmer of locusts descended upon the crops like a dark cloud.

meanings.sent1: The pitcher threw a swarmer that caught the batter off guard.
meanings.sent2: The swarmer pitch had a sharp curve that fooled the hitter.
meanings.sent3: The swarmer of baseballs flying through the air made the game exciting.
meanings.sent4: The swarmer pitch danced like a butterfly before reaching the plate.
meanings.sent5: The swarmer of pitches from the pitcher kept the batters guessing.
